advantages.name: Caern Access
advantages.desc: You have access to another sept's caern.

advantages.name: Awakened Caern
advantages.desc: Your sept is warding an awakened caern or one on the verge of awakening. +1 to your caern value, does not stack! (Players can pool dots)

flaws.name: Caern Pariah
flaws.desc: You are barred from accessing any caerns near your home. (Doesn't apply to a caern your sept owns).

advantages.name: Day Job
advantages.desc: You have a day job. + 1 to subterfuge or persuasion when concealing your Garou nature.

advantages.name: Corroborated Day Job
advantages.desc: Similar to day job, but your co-workers reaffirm your employment. +2 to subterfuge or persuasion when concealing your Garou nature.

advantages.name: Language fluency
advantages.desc: You speak, read and write another language fluently.

flaws.name: Illiterate
flaws.desc: You cannot read or write. Academics and Science are capped at 1.

advantages.name: Clement Lupus
advantages.desc: Your lupus form appears more like a domesticated dog, no mortals would view you as a wolf.

advantages.name: Beautiful
advantages.desc: You are considered beautiful.

advantages.name: Fair Glabro
advantages.desc: Your glabro form is more sinewy than bulky, at a distance you don't look that unusual. Up close you can even pass for hairy or feral. Glabro form no longer causes a 2 die social penalty.

advantages.name: Stunning
advantages.desc: You are considered exceptionally good-looking, you turn heads everywhere you go.

flaws.name: Stench
flaws.desc: Your breath and body odor are supernaturally foul.

flaws.name: Transparent
flaws.desc: For some reason or another, you are an awful liar, do not gain any additional dots in subterfuge.

flaws.name: Wyrm-Marked Flesh
flaws.desc: Your supernatural forms have been touched by some servant of the Wyrm, your forms show signs of wyrm corruption such as balding, open sores or bleeding gums. Take -2 die to all social situations with other Garou who know of these forms. As a two dot flaw these deformities extend to your homid and lupus forms as well.

flaws.name: Repulsive
flaws.desc: Your appearance is exceptionally horrifying.

flaws.name: Ugly
flaws.desc: You aren't very good-looking.

flaws.name: Additional Ban
flaws.desc: Choose another tribe from your own and suffer from their additional ban.

flaws.name: Knowledge Hungry
flaws.desc: At creation, choose a few topics your character is obsessed with. When encountering them make a difficulty 3 willpower check to resist chasing the obsession.

advantages.name: Improviser
advantages.desc: You suffer two dice less penalties for performing Rites in suboptimal conditions.

advantages.name: Expert Assistant
advantages.desc: When assisting with a rite you know, add one additional regular die to the pool.

advantages.name: Moot Caller
advantages.desc: Select 5 social rites, you've mastered them. If allowed during a moot, you can assist in any rite so long as it is performed at a moot or substantially similar gathering of Garou.

advantages.name: Rite Master
advantages.desc: You add +1 die to any dice pools involving Rite knowledge or performance.

advantages.name: Obscure Safe House
advantages.desc: Efforts to seek out anyone within your safe house suffer a 2 die penalty.

advantages.name: Secure Safe House
advantages.desc: Add 2 die to any relevant pools when trying to prevent entry into your safe house.

advantages.name: Luna's Resilience
advantages.desc: In glabro and hispo form you ain two additional health boxes. These carry over into crinos form.

flaws.name: Hopeless Addiction
flaws.desc: Lose 2 die from all pools if you do not indulge in your substance of choice during the last scene.

flaws.name: Addiction
flaws.desc: Lose 1 die from all pools if you do not indulge in your substance of choice during the last scene.

advantages.name: Gift of Form Mastery
advantages.desc: For each dot in this merit, you may select a Gift whose use can be extended to either homid or lupus form.

advantages.name: Moon-Quickened
advantages.desc: Howl at the moon once per night to restore a point of superficial willpower.

advantages.name: Moon-Riled
advantages.desc: Howl at the moon once per night to gain a dot of rage.

flaws.name: Bad Moon Rising
flaws.desc: Howling at the moon is no longer a guarantee to restore rage. Perform a rage check and only gain rage on success.

flaws.name: Folkloric Bane
flaws.desc: You take aggravated damage from a folkloric weapon such as holy water, wolfsbane or the weapon of a true believer. Decide with your ST.

flaws.name: Folkloric Block
flaws.desc: A folkloric block such as wolfsbane, a cross or the presence of a virgin can prevent your entry. Must spend 1 WP to push past it.

flaws.name: Folkloric Tell
flaws.desc: You bear some sort of physical indication of being Garou that unsettles mortals.

flaws.name: Crone's Curse
flaws.desc: Either some curse causes rapid aging or you experienced the first change late in life. -1 HP.

flaws.name: Hellhound
flaws.desc: Your forms are exceptionally frightening. Mortals now suffer the delerium from your hispo and lupus forms as well.

flaws.name: Moon-Thrall
flaws.desc: Upon seeing the moon for the first time each night, you immediately change form to glabro or hispo. (Must still perform rage checks!)

flaws.name: Wolf-Man
flaws.desc: Your crinos form bears a strangely human-looking head. Your lack of snout means that you cannot bite and your delerium is easier to resist.

flaws.name: Wyrm-Touched
flaws.desc: Despite your dedication to Gaia, the Wyrm has burrowed into your soul. Review the flaw in the book and choose one of the Wyrm flaws listed.

advantages.name: Thick Hide
advantages.desc: You are far more robust than other Garou. Your Health tracker equals 4 + your Stamina, rather than 3 + your Stamina.
